sourceDesc.p: Born digital, but generated using XSLT.

person.education: Masters of Library and Information Science in at University of Alberta.
Masters of Arts in English at University of British Columbia.
Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in English & Women’s Studies (minor) at University of Victoria.

occupation.p: Developer at Digital Humanities Innovation Lab, Simon Fraser University.
Teaching Assistant at Department of English, University of British Columbia.
Lead Programmer at Linked Early Modern Drama Online, University of Victoria.
Programmer at The Winnifred Eaton Archive, University of British Columbia.
Lead Programmer (Digital Archive) at Landscapes of Injustice, University of Victoria.
Digital Humanities Consultant at Public Humanities Hub, University of British Columbia.
Research Assistant at The Map of Early Modern London, University of Victoria.
Programmer at The Endings Project, University of Victoria.
Junior Programmer at The Map of Early Modern London, University of Victoria .

list.head: Grants
list.item: External Partner. UBC PhD CoLab. The Adaptive Text Encoding Initiative Network: Antiracist, Decolonial, and Inclusive Markup Interventions. (Principal Investigators: Sydney Lines and Mary Chapman) (2024-04)
Co-Applicant. SSHRC Connection Grant, Onoto Watanna’s CATTLE at 100: Indomitable Women in the West During the Chinese Exclusion Era. (Principal Investigator: Mary Chapman) (2021-05)

Collaborator. SSHRC Partnership Engage Grant, Engaging Public and Academic Audiences to Recover Lost Voices of Scottish History: The Lyon in Mourning Manuscript and the Jacobite Networks of the 1745 Rising. (Principal Investigator: Leith Davis) (2020-05)
Applicant. SSHRC Canadian Graduate Scholarship-Masters Grant, Literary Ecologies of Decolonization in Canada. (2016)
